alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 5:18PM EST until December 17 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 515 PM EST, Social media posts and reports from local law enforcement indicated that numerous roads within Downtown Charleston remain closed due to flooding. In addition, photos indicate that many roads remain blocked by stalled vehicles. A few locations across Mount Pleasant and West Ashley remain flooded. At 5 PM, the French Quarter Creek near Huger was 10.69 ft and rising. At the flood stage is 10.5 ft, the creek will be out of its banks and will produce minor flooding of yards and docks along the creek. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen across the eastern portions of Charleston and Berkeley Counties today. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Daniel Island, Downtown Charleston, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, West Ashley, James Island, Fort Sumter, Johns Island, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Kiawah Island, Charleston Naval Complex, Don Holt Bridge and Charles Towne Landing.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
